latest.title: Change of name and TIDM
latest.content:
Today 10:49
RNS Number : 5289O
Cykel AI PLC
12 January 2026
This announcement contains information which, prior to its disclosure, was inside information as stipulated under Regulation 11 of the Market Abuse (Amendment) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019/310 (as amended). Upon the publication of this announcement via a Regulatory Information Service, this inside information is now considered to be in the public domain.
12 January 2026
DeFi Development Corporation UK PLC (formerly Cykel AI PLC)
(the "
Company
")
Change of name and TIDM
DeFi Development Corporation UK PLC (LSE: DFDV), a Main Market listed company which offers an AI agent platform that enables businesses to automate tasks through the use of specialised digital workers for
sales, recruitment and research and has adopted
a Solana focused digital asset treasury strategy,
is pleased to announce that the Company has changed its name and will trade under its new name DeFi Development Corporation UK PLC with effect from 12 January 2026.
In addition, with effect from 13 January 2026, the Company's TIDM will be amended from "CYK" to "DFDV" on the Main Market of the London Stock Exchange.
The decision to change name to
DeFi Development Corporation UK PLC
reflects the Company's continued development of its Solana focused digital asset treasury strategy as previously announced on 28 August 2025. The "Cykel" trading name will continue to be used for the Company's AI agent activities.
In addition, the Company's website address will also change to www.defidevcorp.co.uk.
Shareholders should note that their shareholdings will be unaffected by the change of name. Existing share certificates should be retained as they will remain valid for all purposes and no new share certificates will be issued.
The Company's ISIN and SEDOL will remain unchanged. The Company's Legal Entity Identifier remains 213800QEO6L6JAS62H02.
The Directors of the Company accept responsibility for this announcement.
*ENDS*
For further information:
Company
Michael Chan
Director
investors@defidevcorp.co.uk
First Sentinel (Corporate Adviser)
Brian Stockbridge

latest.title: Further re warrants
latest.content:
4 Dec 2025 07:00
RNS Number : 1455K
Cykel AI PLC
04 December 2025
This announcement contains information which, prior to its disclosure, was inside information as stipulated under Regulation 11 of the Market Abuse (Amendment) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019/310 (as amended). Upon the publication of this announcement via a Regulatory Information Service, this inside information is now considered to be in the public domain.
4 December 2025
Cykel AI PLC
("
Cykel AI
" or the "
Company
")
Further re Warrants
Cykel AI PLC (LSE:CYK) announces the following with respect to the warrants, full details of which are set out in the Company's announcement of 28 August 2025.
Warrants cancellation
The Company announces that it has agreed to the cancellation of 5,000,000 Pre-Paid and Investor Warrants (together, the "Warrants"). This will result in the repayment of the deposit already paid for the Pre-Paid Warrants (less a contribution to transaction costs) to the cancelling holders in accordance with the terms of the Warrants. Following this cancellation, the Company has 41,666,667 Warrants outstanding.
Warrants extension details
Under the existing terms, Warrants are not capable of being exercised until certain conditions which are detailed in the 28 August 2025 announcement have been satisfied and would have expired if such conditions were not satisfied by 30 November 2025. The Company and the remaining warrant holders, including DeFi Development Corp, have agreed to extend the period within which these conditions may be satisfied to 1 June 2026. Accordingly, the Warrants will only become exercisable once the relevant conditions have been fulfilled on or before 1 June 2026.
If the conditions have not been satisfied by 1 June 2026, the Warrants will expire and be cancelled and the deposit for the Pre-Paid Warrants will be repaid to the relevant investors (less pre
‑
agreed contributions to transaction costs).
All other terms of the Warrants remain unchanged.
Pre-Paid Warrants and Investor Warrants have the meanings given to them in the announcement published on 28 August 2025.
For further information:
Cykel AI plc
Michael Chan
CEO
investors@cykel.ai
First Sentinel (Financial Adviser)
Brian Stockbridge
brian@first-sentinel.com
+44 (0) 7858 888 007

Guy Wheatley

latest.title: Changes in Board Composition
latest.content:
3 Nov 2025 07:00
RNS Number : 7828F
Cykel AI PLC
03 November 2025
This announcement contains information which, prior to its disclosure, was inside information as stipulated under Regulation 11 of the Market Abuse (Amendment) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019/310 (as amended). Upon the publication of this announcement via a Regulatory Information Service, this inside information is now considered to be in the public domain.
3 November 2025
Cykel AI PLC
("Cykel AI" or the "Company")
Changes in Board Composition
Cykel AI PLC (LSE:CYK) announces that Nicholas Lyth has resigned as Interim Chairman of the Company, with immediate effect.
The Board would like to take this opportunity to thank Mr. Lyth for his contributions to the Company and wish him well for the future.
Michael Chan will assume the role of Chairman on an interim basis pending the appointment of a Non-executive Chairman in due course.
For further information:
Cykel AI plc
Michael Chan
CEO
investors@cykel.ai
First Sentinel (Financial Adviser)
Brian Stockbridge
brian@first-sentinel.com
+44 (0) 7858 888 007

company_30s.what_they_do: Cykel AI builds AI‑powered sales assistants and go‑to‑market platforms that help businesses automate customer engagement and close deals faster.
company_30s.why_they_matter: The AI sales‑automation market is growing fast—companies are looking for tools that can handle millions of interactions with minimal human effort. Cykel AI’s products aim to cut sales cycle time and lift conversion rates, making them a potentially valuable player in a high‑growth niche.
company_30s.current_state: The firm is still pre‑revenue, raising capital to build its technology and grow its team. It has gone through several board changes, a name change, and a Bitcoin‑treasury reserve strategy, but it is still burning cash and has yet to generate income. The stock is trading near record lows.

rns_narrative: Cykel AI has been focused on developing its AI sales agent, Eve, and a broader GTM AI platform, signalling steady product progress.
The company has raised capital multiple times (a £2.8 m round and a £750 k placement) to fund development and keep the business afloat.
Recent filings show board reshuffles, a name change, and a move to hold Bitcoin as part of its treasury—signals that management is looking for new ways to stabilize cash flow.
Despite a reported 68% month‑on‑month growth, there is no revenue yet, indicating that the company is still in the early‑stage build‑phase.

crowd_tape.dominant_theme: Radio silence – the market has abandoned the stock and there is no chatter.
crowd_tape.bull_narrative: No bullish voices remain – the stock is essentially ignored by the market.
crowd_tape.bear_narrative: All bears are shouting about the lack of revenue and the deep drawdown, reinforcing the narrative of a failing business.
crowd_tape.sentiment_shift: From panic to apathy – the initial shock has faded, leaving a vacuum that a surprise catalyst could fill.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends is flat – there is no public interest, giving maximum surprise potential if a catalyst hits.

near_term_catalysts: First commercial contract win or pilot with a mid‑size client.
Completion of the next funding round or a strategic partnership announcement.
A product launch that demonstrates tangible revenue potential.
A chart breakout above the 0.5p level with a spike in daily volume.
expect_next.watch_for: Look for a volume surge, short covering signs (e.g., a sudden spike in shares sold), and any institutional buying activity. A close above the 0.5p threshold on a higher volume day would be a strong confirmation.
expect_next.timing_regime: The stock is in a late‑stage washout. It is early for contrarian traders who are ready to enter once a catalyst or volume spike confirms that capitulation is over.

buy_vs_sell.lean: Contrarian Bullish – deep crash with no market chatter and early‑stage product progress.
buy_vs_sell.bull_case: The stock is down over 80 %. A compressed spring is forming, and the recent product and funding news suggest that the company is finally moving toward revenue. A 50 % bounce would double the current price, while a 100 % recovery would triple it – a classic asymmetric payoff.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: If the company fails to secure a contract or raise additional capital, the price could fall a few more percent, but 80 %+ of the decline has already happened, limiting the downside.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: Risk 10 % further decline vs Reward 100 % bounce – a 1:10 asymmetry that makes the trade attractive for a contrarian.

playbook.if_bullish: Enter 25 % of the target position at the current low, add on a volume spike or a daily close above 0.5p, and set a tight stop 5 % below the entry to protect against a brief retracement.
playbook.if_watching: Hold until you see a daily close above 0.5p on a higher‑than‑average volume day, or until a new contract or funding announcement appears. Do not buy on the first volume spike alone.
playbook.if_passing: Skip this if you see any clear signs of bankruptcy, a pending delisting, or a regulatory hold‑up that would lock the price further down.

ai_insights.bottom_line: 86 % crash, no chatter, early‑stage AI tech – classic contrarian play with a 1:10 upside potential.
